content.detailedDescription: At approximately 4pm eastern time, after having an eye doctor appointment in allentown, pa for a check up, i noticed an object. it was east of my position at 11 0'clock and about 30-35' off the horizon. at first i thought it was a kite but i realized it was way higher than a kite would have been flown. it had a sort of pulsating light, or reflecting of the sun that made it seem like it was pulsating or flashing. it would get brighter and then dim down to almost nothing. then return to the brightness again. it also didn't seem to be moving at all. if it was a weather ballon i think i would have detected some sort of motion but i didn't see any. this went on for about 10 minutes until i couldn't see it pulsating anymore.
content.summary: Pulsating light in sky.

content.detailedDescription:
While taking pictures of the night sky on saturday, may 16, 2009 betwee 8:00pm and 9:00pm mountain time i found this triangle.

i was using zoom and the line following the triangle craft is what the camera captured while the shutter was open. unfortunately i was not using a tripod at the time, therefore the uneven looking line indicating travel of the craft.

i was using a nikon s630 with night landscape scene. 

i did not realize this object was captured until reviewing the files the next day.
content.summary: Triangle high up captured on digital camera

content.detailedDescription: The picture was taken in pittsburgh, pa at 11:20am on may 18, 2009, in frick park looking west in the grassed area shown in the satellite picture.  the black rectangle in the satellite picture shows the approximate location of the photographer.  a hawk had just taken flight from the large tree close to the center of the satellite picture.  the picture shows the object below and to the left of the hawk. the hawk was the intended subject of the photograph and the object was only noticed on later viewing of the image.  the picture is a full frame image, no cropping or post processing.  photographic details are 24mm-105mm f4 is lens at 105mm, canon 5d mark 2, f11, 1/1000 sec, iso 500, sharpness 1, auto white balance, image stabilized.
content.summary: Digital picture showed ufo on later examination

content.detailedDescription:
Murrysville, pa - this is first pic i took of ufo.  wasn't the best so i didn't upload it last night.  after using photoshop to adjust contrast & levels--this green alien head that appears to be waving was visible.  unbelievable!  there were no trees in the way that could explain it.  the pic named img_3749.Jpg is the original pic out of the camera-untouched in any way.  so, if you don't believe it, download it and put it in your own photo program and adjust it yourself--then stand back and look at it!  cool!

i blew up the other objects in the pic so you could see them better (constrastall).  the smaller white streak showed up in two pics so must not be camera flaw...Probably is a probe of some sort.
content.summary: Same report info of amber/orange ufo-1st pic w/contrast shows alien?

content.detailedDescription:
I was filming the beautiful desert landscapes out the window over texas using my blackberry pearl on my flight from raleigh to las vegas
and my bberry light was on by default. the "spheres" are my bberry light.
the 3 panes in the window, each slightly apart from each other
created what looks exactly like 3 separate moving lights/spheres/orbs in the sky.
to get them to do formations, i turned the phone clockwise/anticlockwise and
nearer & farther from the window.
it's amazing that the phone never exposes itself in the window at any time
easily concealing the source of the effect.

i've easily fooled people into believing they're ufos....Amazing!
i'm uploading this to educate the public on videos shot from aircraft
windows because my footage immediately discounted the authencity of videos i had previously seen with similar lights (red/blue/white) shot from choppers & planes. 
since i was flying to nevada, the "evidence" could easily have pointed to area 51 activity.

no doubt there are real cases of ufos existing. this is not one of them.

enjoy!
best regards,
-kenz-

ps. i own the copyright to this video but am giving mufon permission
to post it/publish it wherever you want given the credit of: 
"kenz desai 2009. thekenz@hotmail.Com"
content.summary: This is a fake but looks very convincing.

content.detailedDescription:
Bright light north scottsdale, just above mountain to the east.

visible until sunrise, sun came up next to it, slightly south.

stationary for an hour 

whitnessed by five of us.


i first noticed it at 5am pointed it out to the others when i got to work.


oldie but to me a goodie
morning 1998 aril 29th cigar shaped object north northeast of scottsdale observed for nearly three hours estimated distance 78 miles, altitude 100,000 ft size at least one mile in length (of course real rough calculations) reported it to peter in seattle. 

walt
content.summary: Bright light

content.detailedDescription:
I stopped while on the way to work to take some photos from a hilltop just outside boulder colorado. the photo was taken looking north west over the city.
when i observed the photo i thought i might have moved the camera but realized the streak is the object moving at high speed. i had the nikon s630 rested on top of the car so as to avoid any camera shake.

the object is perfectly round some miles from me but i don't know how far away.

just for reference, the moon was in the southern sky and only a small slice.
content.summary: Taking photos of early morning sky found a round object in photo

content.detailedDescription: These 3 photos were taken after one with ray emitting from bottom and prior to video
content.summary: Same as stated in previous report

content.detailedDescription: After taking 10 digital photos i set camera on movie setting and placed on top of car.  i gort back in  car and let it record for 30 to 50 minutes.  when i retreived camera  the battery was dead and it had recorded only 3 minutews and 57 seconds.  i always have fully charged batteries in my camera.
content.summary: Same as stated in previous report

content.detailedDescription: My husband & i were walking our dog after midnight along the creek path,right in the village, when he noticed a big star-sized yellow sparkly light coming towards us from the west. it could have been 50ft. in the air or 10,000... we don't know. it was silent and moved like an insect being blown in the wind, but only slightly. it was a breezy night in pincher creek. its speed was erratic, speeding up, almost stopping, moving slowly, speeding up... we watched it go by us to the north, then turned around to watch it continue to move on a straight path (more or less). the light grew brighter for about 10 seconds, after it passed us, 'til we had to squint, then it quickly faded to a dull red glow before the object faded into the darkness. the whole encounter took place in silence, the village was quiet, it was a clear night... we were the only things making noise. it lasted about 2-3 minutes.
content.summary: Bright yellow sparkly big star light

content.detailedDescription:
Murrysville, pa:  coming back from monroeville mall around 9:25p.M.-ish, girlfriend was coming down hill on rt 22 by wendy's when looking south, saw an amber/orangey, larger-than-a-star light that looked similar as one we both saw on 5/13/09.  she took the 1st kid who went with daughter & friend home, then got back on rt. 22 towards delmont.  object was seen at that time by 3 people total in car.  no other stars were out yet. no blinking light, it was steady glow--the only light in the sky. not chinese lanterns.  

her story: decided to try and drive over towards it south off of rt. 22.  it was no longer visible.  took 2nd kid home in delmont, was returning to home in murrysville on rt. 22, heading west past rick's sports bar, saw it again in western sky to the left of the large radio tower w/3 or 4 red lights (daughter said it is by cochran car dealership up on hill in monroeville.  as we watched it, it got substantially brighter and bigger (like 4 times bigger)... enough that we said, "whoa, whoa!  look what it's doing!  it can't be a plane!"  it was moving right, towards the tower while it did it's thing several times--getter brighter, then dimming.  we were going to drive to the hill in monroeville by the tower to check it out, when it dimmed to nothing...Gone.  we turned left onto our road, school rd. south.  coming up to top of hill we decided to turn onto farmland that has a 360 view of surrounding area and look for it again.  we saw overhead a small star-like object moving in wiggling s-pattern towards south--same pattern as on the 13th!  daughter (with much better eyes) saw a total of 5 objects moving within 15-20 minutes, most straight overhead by the big dipper.  one i couldn't see until it slowed down  then 'flashed' white then moved faster (note: we've seen weird small 'flashes' in the sky--looked and saw nothing... wondering what caused it--perhaps this is the cause!)  another craft moving s to n with crazy flashing lights she said moved in arching pattern, back and forth--no sound.  she called me on phone about 10:30pm, told me to grab canon camera and go shoot pictures of amber 'thing' that was back in southern sky.  at first i couldn't see it because of the trees (she saw it from top of hill clearly--she flashed her headlights at it several times and it scared them by getting brighter like it was coming closer to them).  it made erratic 'jump' up above the sky, flashed brighter, moved down, then, up-down, brighter, bigger, more to the right, etc.  not knowing how to use a rebel camera, took pics on auto, but flash kept flashing.  got one good pic i'm uploading with blowups.  the other night it didn't look exactly round and perhaps this is the shape?  the light under it was not visible while taking the pics--perhaps a probe?  it dimmed to nothing before she came back home and could try and get better pics.  she saw 2 other dim objects high up with binoculars shortly afterward we both saw what appeared to be a triangle, rounded edges, with 2 white lights on back, red on bottom, one flashing white light flying e silently...  all between 9:30 to 11:00pm!  weather clear & cold, no wind.  similar orange ufos on youtube video in scotland on may 11, 2009 around 10:30pm with link to tv report:  http://www.Youtube.Com/watch?V=-wquuar789e
content.summary: Another amber/orange ufo seen in murrysville, pa-plus 7 more ufos that night!

content.detailedDescription: I was debating whether or not to post this sighting.  it may have been a satellite, as i'm not sure how quickly one would move across the night sky when viewed with the naked eye.  it was 10:30pm on 5/18/09 and i was headed out to work.  i stopped at my car and looked up at the sky as i frequently do and i noticed a star that was moving quickly and erratically through the sky.  from my perspective, it was a single point of light exactly the same size/brightness of an average star when viewed with the naked eye.  it was solid whitish/yellow, did not blink, and it did not appear to change color/shape/size etc...  it moved diagonally from about 70 degrees above the horizon on my right-hand side to about 40 degrees above the horizon on my left hand side (estimates), crossing about 2-3 feet of sky at arms length.  it was definitely headed in one direction (not looping around or anything), but moved randomly side to side from my perspective.  i lost sight of the object as it faded out.  there were a few wispy patches of clouds, so it may have just passed behind one of these and given the illusion of fading out.  the entire sighting lasted about 10 or 15 seconds.  if you need to contact me, 10am-1pm est is the best time b/c i work 3rd shift and sleep in the afternoon/evenings.  thanks!
content.summary: Fast, erratic moving star

content.detailedDescription:
While talking on my cellphone around sunset i noticed what appeared to be venus on the horizon to the northwest from my kitchen window.  for the next five minutes the object remained in the same location and became brighter as daylight faded.  this increase in brightness caught my attention since as the sky got darker the object seemed both too bright and too large to be venus.  at this point i assumed it was one of the many airplanes in the phoenix sky, but quickly realized that it wasn't moving and was not in any of the usual flight paths (my apartment has a view of the south mountains and estrella range to the west and often airplane lights can be seen to the untrained eye as an arc of lights in the sky).  but this object was much different and i went to get my binoculars.  the object in the binoculars appeared to be a milky white color, luminescent, and seemed to be an upside down triangle or diamond shape.  at times there was sparkling or blinking white light on the left side of (and within) the object and then dark areas on the right center.  from my vantage point the object remained completely motionless for nearly 30 minutes and then completely disappeared when a fairly small string of clouds drifted in front of it.  two minutes later, the clouds drifted and the object was completely gone.  i had been tracking the position of the object in relation to the corner of a building in my line of vision and it did not move as a planet would.  about 15 minutes after it disappeared, a lightning stormfront rolled in from the southwest.
local news report mentioned that 1000s of people witnessed this as far away as sedona (which would be in the correct direction from my postion).  possibly a nasa weather balloon headed to new mexico, according to the news report.  i've never seen anything like this before and i cannot explain it well enough to do it any accurate justice.
content.summary: Motionless bright white inverted triangle in sunset sky for over 20 minutes

content.detailedDescription:
I was inside on the computer when i recieved a call from son in law who lives 6 blocks away told me to rush outside and by looking towards kingman which is to our southeast, i would see a ufo.  well i checked and sure enough it was right there, about 1/8  the size of a full moon. seemingly over kingman, az but impossible to judge actual size or distance could have actually been over flagstaff.
i immediatly rushed in to grab a very cheap small pair of binoculars i own to verify it.  i could barely identify bright lights on object.  i then ran across to my neighbors knowing she owns some decent binoculars.  i pointed out the object to her and she ran for her pair which we both used to confirm the object was in fact a ufo.  at first i was somewhat taken aback but felt comfortable knowing she was confirming the sighting. she described it as shaped like a halloween acorn candy (yellow orange ones).
it was as if it was emiting a bright white light from what i felt may have been the bottom of the craft.

after discussing the object for a moment or two she decided we needed more witnesses as noone else that we could see on the block was witnessing this.
she ran in to call her husband (a real skeptic as i found out), when he came out he immediately dismissed it as a star and we both noticed it had suddenly diminished in size, and as he walked away and laughed it off, it completely disappeared.  it did momentarily come back as a small object and then a mass of cloud covering moved in.
content.summary: Bright as full moon upside down triangle stationary

content.detailedDescription: About 7:23pm i walked out on my patio when i noticed an extremely bright light to the north, northwest sky. it really stuck out because it seem to be the only thing that was shining in the sky at the time. there were no stars noticeable in the sky.I watched the object for about 5 minutes and it seem not to move at all. i ran inside and grab the binoculars to get a better look. it seem to be transparent and balloon shaped. after about 20 25 the object seem to turn an orange color, just like the sky a soon as he sun goes down. i watched the object till about 8:03pm and the object became very faint and hard to see.
content.summary: Very high altitude transparent balloon like object

content.detailedDescription:
At 7:50 p.M. arizona time my husband noticed a bright illuminated object stationary above mohave valley arizona more towards the eastern horizon line.
he summoned me to wittness the object which appeared to be either a weather ballon or hot air ballon.
the problem with either of the obvious conclusions is that it was transparent and glowing brightly white.
while observing the object through a pair of field binoculars we both noticed a long rope, cord or (other) hanging from beneath the object and at the very tip another object appearing to be a globe of some sort hung and glowed brightly as well.
trying to be objective, we looked for signs of a basket or holder for people if it was an air ballon but there did not appear to be any, however we did notice that there was movement in the bottom of the ballon shaped object, (inside of it in fact).
we could not determine with our glasses if it was humans or not.
what made this sighting intresting is that there is presently a build up to the west of us, of storm clouds, this object was not drifting, not rising or descending, just hanging still in the air, we would have assumed that (if) it was an air ballon that it would have moved, but it did not.
the next assumtion, that it was a hot air ballon had already been dispelled by nothing to hold travelers beneath a flame fueled craft, if what we saw inside of the object was human air travelers then we have no idea how they fueled the craft.
the object is still in the sky at 8:26 p.M. but now only appears intermittentedly and is not visible constantly as it was before sunset.
what it is we can not say, i have seen many u.F.O.S but nothing like this.
attached is two camera phone photographs of the object which has limited blow up capabilities but when i blew them up on my computer the object actually appears to be a globe shaped object.  in fact a luminescent globe shaped object was sighted over arizona yesterday, so we don't honestly know what the dickens it was.
thanks
shaba
content.summary: Illuminated cone shaped object hoovering above mohave valley arizona

content.detailedDescription: glowing  object/figure on grouind below ufo vanished  and then what appeared to be some type of light/energy  ray materialed out of bottom of ufo. bottom end of ray appears to encapsule some type of object/figure.
content.summary: Same as stated in previous report

content.detailedDescription: Object was 2 miles directly east of hulman international airpor.  to the eye it was just a very large bright stationary object, but i knew it wasn,t what it appeared to be.  glowing object/figure materialized on the ground directly below ufo
content.summary: Apppeared as large bright object in eastern sky 15 degrees above horizon.

content.detailedDescription:
Wife and i went out onto the back porch to have a cigarette.

no sooner then stepping out onto the porch my wife looked towards the south west and noticed a strange color in the sky.

we thought it might be a small plane in jeopardy, mostly due to the color. we do see patterns of small planes in flight around here with the red and green lights. but this one was larger and the orange looked exactly like a flame in a campfire.

as it travelled what really caused us to notice was it broke apart and a piece of the fire swung out and under, like tethered to it like in a "c" motion. and the smaller piece tracked with the larger. all we saw was light, no structures. the larger piece that fell under seemed to fade.

as the main fireball tracked north, tiny pieces of light seemed to fall off it. like a spark or ember dropping straight down. these were extremely small, had to squint to notice. this happened at least 4 times at fairly regular intervals as it made it course.

we assumed it was a meteor or something burning up as it went across, but travelled alot slower then a shooting star. about as fast as typical plane traffic around here.

we lost sight of it as its arc in the horizon was obscured by trees. if i were to look directly south at 0' and north at 180', the course it took this is what happened. if i was to guess, looking off deck we noticed it at a 15' and then around 30' the "c" dropped off, 60' a ember, same at 90' 100' and lost it due to trees at 120'. the whole thing was about a minute.

my feelings were a plane in trouble. as it continued more or less straight with no dropping i thought it could be a meteor and got concerned due to imagining what size it might have been if it made impact around here. with the embers i wondered if they woudl light anything on fire, but seemed to fade out as there dropped.

i don't know what it was. course was straight so maybe meterological or a plane in trouble.
content.summary: Looked orange like a campfire.

content.detailedDescription: I was looking  up in the sky( to look for the planet nibiru and at the stars) when i seen an orb flying across the sky and the ten minutes later there was another one going in the same direction as the first i have never seen a ufo until that night. it freaked me out but i already knew of ufos from the bible and such but never experienced this and i look up at the stars at least once a week and i have never seen this before. after 37 years of nothing i was finally shown. i told the three witnesses to look up and they also seen it. i lost sight when my son called my name i looked away and when i told them to look up they also seen the second one. i shown 4 people that night and they all seen it.
content.summary: Looked like orb flying straight line across the sky i seen one, then like ten minutes later there was a different one, like it was following the first one.

content.detailedDescription:
Was at lake las vegas watching a band and had the felling i watch being watched, i looked up and saw a very bright light moving fast from the north west. i told my wife to look up and it had stopped and was very dim, i had my wife look at the two bright stars and told her to watch the dim one in the middle, it started to glow bright then went east vary fast and disappeared.
i see them quite often it���s fun to see were not alone. this the third one my wife had seen
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Flew in stopped then went to the east very fast.

content.detailedDescription: I had just gotten home from work and my next door neighbor called to me and said "hey, do you see that thing up there??" the reported object was viewed through binoculars. it is a spherical, milky white orb with something on the bottom, some kind of small protrusion. it's almost translucent, but you can't see inside of it, still pretty much opaque. relatively windy day today, you can see the clouds moving kind of quick. altitude is relatively high, clouds passed by and you could see it was above the clouds as its view was obscured by the clouds. object is not moving at all, not moving in any direction or changing altitude. if this were a weather balloon, or even a giant tethered balloon, you would definitely see some sway to it as there is definitely some wind up there. considering it's altitude, the thing has to be just massive.. very weird...
content.summary: Gigantic orb definitely not a weather balloon.

content.detailedDescription: What appeared to look like a ufo was actually a weather balloon.  i have seen alot of weather ballons in the past and i have actually seen ufo's and there is a big difference. there was no ufo visible in the sky on sunday, may 17, 2009.
content.summary: What appeared to look like a ufo was actually a weather balloon.    i have seen too many to know the difference.

content.detailedDescription:
May 16th (1st sighting): approx 10:30pm my boyfriend went outside to walk the dog and returned shortly later with a concerned look on his face and told me that he had just watched a very strange light in the sky. his encounter was that the light at first seemed like a plane, and was traveling from west to east. he then further noticed that it had no flashing lights or running lights like a plane. he stood and watched as the light seemed to have turned to the north and just disappeared. after hearing this we both returned outside to further investigate, but found nothing more. 

may 17th (2nd sighting): at 9:45pm we are driving home from town (within 3 miles of 1st sighting) traveling n and from the passenger side window i notice this bright light in the sky. it was traveling west to east and the light was a blueish white and bigger and brighter than a star. i kept staring at it trying to see its running or flashing lights. but when i could not see them i asked my boyfriend (who was driving) if the light looked like what he saw the night before. when he seen it, he immediatly tried to follow its direction. it was the same thing that he seen the night before. we tried following it for approx 2 minutes, but the trees got in the way of seeing it any longer.
content.summary: Light in the sky two nights in a row, around same time period. no flashing or running lights like a plane.

content.detailedDescription:
Yesterday, sunday may 17,2009, i was sitting out on the back deck of my
home in the sunshine. it was a beautiful clear day..The sky was brilliant
blue. there were little or no clouds.  
i heard above me the sound of a plane engine, but it was more like the buzz of a smaller sized private plane. we live along the flight pattern
of the bend municipal airport, so it was not unusual to see a small private plane flying over on a clear day. i glanced up at it ...But did a 
double take when it appeared to be pulling something larger than itself.
it looked like a bigger airplane. as i looked more closely it appeared to
be a very large plane, about the size of a water carrier.I knew that planes could not travel that close together.The larger plane was right on the tail of the smaller one. even more strange was that it had an almost translucent look to it. it was white and vaporous looking..
...I hesitate to say it but it looked like i could see through it.
as the planes traveled in the direction of the airport,they were soon
going to be out of sight over the top of my roof.A i stood, i saw the
larger plane make a sharp right turn and fly off in that direction.
i ran through the house to the front door and ran out...(it would have 
taken only a matter of 6-7 seconds)..And i expected to resume watching the two planes continue flying in the directions they were headed...But 
i did not see either plane. i could still hear the engine
of the small plane as it seemed to get further away. i should have been
able to see it ...But it was no where in sight.  the
larger plane was not in the distance..It seemed to have just dissapeared into thin air. 
 i called the airport to see if anyone landing around that time had reported anything strange just before landing at the airport, but no one
had. i can't imagine if the pilot of that airplane had seen the large plane on it's tail, that they would not have reported it.
  i have never seen or reported any incident like this before.
i am doing so now, in order to find out if anyone else saw what i did. it 
is very uncomfortable to have seen something like this and to be the only
known witness.
content.summary: A small private airplane was being tailed by a large "vaporous" looking aircraft which was in the shape of a large airplane.

content.detailedDescription: It looks like a weather balloon but it's not moving plus the shape is a perfect sphere. it might just be a tetheered giant ballon.
content.summary: Stationary transparent orb viewed for at least an hour.

content.detailedDescription: Approximarely 2 hours earlier i had seen same object with 2 others outside on my deck. this time my wife called me out to have a cigarette and witin two minutes or so , the same type and size object moving west to east appeared( aspirin-sized) it got about mid-sky when a plane came into view . the object was moving almost exactly west to east, the plane was heading in the typical sw to ne and as the plane and object got close to each other  i said to my wife that the pilot in the plane is probably able to see the ufo , then suddenly the light just went out or kinda faded out within 3 seconds. this only confirmed what i saw earlier in the night. i feel this object decided not to be visible anymore.
content.summary: 2nd object - was a bright bluish white light moving  west to east, moved halfway across sky then faded out when airplane appeared in sky.

content.detailedDescription: @ the time , myself and two other family members were outside and on the deck, enjoying a drink , and cigs when i noticed a bright light moving over the house(from west to east) and pointed it out to jack and my mother. the light was bluish-white, silent, and  appeared to be high altitude . both jack and my mother thought it was an  airplane at first but there was no blinking lights and the light never dimmed as it got further away. we were able to watch it until it disappeared in the horizon/trees in the distance. we were all unsure what we saw but we all agreed it was odd.
content.summary: Object - was a bright bluish white light moving  west to east, silent and took 20 seconds to travel length of visible sky.

content.detailedDescription:
It was later on in the evening, around 11pm, and i was standing out on my porch, which faces east, having a cigarette before going to bed. my wife was already upstairs reading at that point in time. 

it was a cold night, probably 40f, which is a bit cool for us this time of year. however, it allowed for a wonderful, unobstructed view of the stars. there were more visible than normal. very clear, and sharp. there was almost no twinkle to the stars at all. i was simply gazing around, star to star, when out of the corner of my eye, i saw something moving quite fast almost straight above me. from the corner of my eye i thought "shooting star" because of the speed and the direction of its travel.

the speed was consistent with a shooting star, as was the direction; i couldn't catch sight of it at first after trying to find it looking direct of instead of with my peripheral vision. i finally did catch it looking directly at it, and i was sure it was a shooting star because it glowed blue, and it might have had a little tail to it, but i cannot be sure. 

no more than two seconds after i locked my eyes on it, the thing went absolutely nuts. started zig-zagging and jumping around and looping, yet still traveling in the same direction that it was heading in the first place. it took me about two seconds of watching this to realize that it wasn't behaving like a shooting star, and this quite literally freaked me out. instead of watching it til i saw it disappear, i dropped my cigarette, turned around and bolted into the house, forgetting that my wife was no longer downstairs, but was up in our bedroom. my heart was racing, but i went back outside again to finish my cigarette and size up the situation. i did not see anything more while i was out there. 

it made no sound, and seemed to be about as bright as a faint shooting star, and there was absolutely no sound.
content.summary: What seemed light a shooting star goes erratic.

content.detailedDescription:
It was later on in the evening, 10:30pm or so. i was seated on my front porch with my wife; we'd just had dinner at a local restaurant, and since it was a mild evening in terms of temperature, we thought we'd catch some fresh air. our house is in the middle of a small village that's somewhat rural in location, so we can usually see a good amount of stars on a clear night despite living across the street from a filling station. star-gazing is something we enjoy doing. by no means are either of us professionals in terms of astronomy, but we've spent a fair amount of time gazing up at the night skies. 

out of the corner of my eye, i caught something in the northeast sky, directly over a large tree in our neighbors yards. the object was quite a distance away though. it was a dim light, about half the brilliance of an average star seen with the naked eye, and about the same size. what struck me was how slow it was moving. in fact, i said to my wife, "well would you look at that slow-moving plane." 

she looked up and saw it too, and just after she looked up the object began to increase in brightness, to where it seemed to reach the brilliance of at least double the brightness of the brightest star in the sky that night; so bright it blotted out the starlight in a circle surrounding it. the brightened for about 3 or four seconds, then began to dim and became so faint i could barely see it when using my peripheral vision, though i still saw it continuing in a straight line until it disappeared altogether. 

we commented to each other on the strangeness of the situation, as each of us have seen many satellites, birds, and planes in flight at night. we noticed no flashing lights on this object; just a single white light source, the one that brightened and dimmed. also, there was no sound accompanying this object, as it was dead silent. as i mentioned, i've seen many things which i'd initially were unidentifiable, but soon became identified with further scrutiny. this was the exception in the sense that i have not been able to settle upon a concrete explanation for the occurrence, which is why i'm reporting it as a ufo in the chances that someone else saw it that night. 

another reason why i couldn't settle on the satellite explanation was that it seemed to be traveling from northwest to southeast, and i'd never seen one in that location before, or traveling in a similar direction. i suppose the most likely explanation is satellite, but as i'm not sure, i've reported this to mufon.
content.summary: Strange, slow-moving light increases brightness, fades.
